title: Strengthening Capabilities to Handle Unexpected Science Classroom Situations

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in teaching basic science curricula and proficiency in using fundamental digital tools
context.additional_context: Situational responsiveness training for current secondary science teachers through DUE (Discipline-Based Undergraduate Education) methodology application

learning_goals: Learners can proactively identify three or more unpredictable situations during science classes and develop response strategies using the DUE (Design, Use, Evaluate) methodology.
By applying modular lesson design techniques, learners can propose solutions to achieve 80% or more of learning objectives even in unexpected disruptions.
Learners can use digital tools (tablets/online collaboration platforms) to document real-time classroom issues and collaboratively derive solutions with peer teachers.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
